intro: Selaginella guichenotii, commonly known as the common spikemoss, is a vascular fern that belongs to the family Selaginellaceae. It is a small, evergreen plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its spiral arrangement of leaves and a spore-bearing structure called a strobilus. It is characterized by its ability to survive in low-light conditions and its unique ability to regenerate from its rhizomes. Selaginella guichenotii plays an important ecological role in maintaining soil stability and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
